Column Comment.0: RESERVES ENTITY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a reserves entity. A reservesentity may be comprised of a single business object (such as a well) or a group ofbusiness objects (such as all the completions producing from a pool).
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: CREATED BY BUSINESS ASSOC ID: The business associate who created thisreserve entity.
Column Comment.3: DESCRIPTION: Narrative descriptive remarks that accompany the license condition.Could include the definition at which the values apply (such as 101.325 kilopascalsand 15 degrees Celsius).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.6: RESERVE ENTITY GROUPING CRITERIA TYPE: the criteria used to group reserveentities, such as aeria extent, lease based etc.
Column Comment.7: LAST APPROVE BA ID: the unique identifier for the business associate who lastapproved changes to the RESENT estimates.
Column Comment.8: LAST UPDATE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: The identifier of the business associatewho last updated the reserves for this resent.
Column Comment.9: LAST UPDATE DATE: the last date that the reserves estimates for this RESENTwere updated and approved.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: PRIMARY PRODUCT: The primary product produced by this PDEN
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: REPORT IND: A Y/N flag added to allow users to keep track of rows that should beincluded in reporting.
Column Comment.14: RESENT NAME: The long name associated with a specific Reserve Entity
Column Comment.15: SHORT NAME: Common short name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.17: UPDATE SCHEDULED PERIOD: Indicates a period of time. Possible values areDAY, MONTH, YEAR. The schedule for updating this reserve entity.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
